definitions.definition: A lively dance originating in Scotland; also, the music of this dance; often called a Scottish (or Scotch) reel.
A kind of spool, turning on an axis, on which yarn, threads, lines, or the like, are wound.
A machine on which yarn is wound and measured into lays and hanks, —-- for cotton or linen it is fifty-four inches in circuit; for worsted, thirty inches.
A device consisting of radial arms with horizontal stats, connected with a harvesting machine, for holding the stalks of grain in position to be cut by the knives.
A short compilation of sample film work used as a demonstrative resume in the entertainment industry.
To unwind, to bring or acquire something by spinning or winding something else.
definitions.example: He reeled off some tape from the roll and sealed the package.

definitions.definition: To walk shakily or unsteadily; to stagger; move as if drunk or not in control of oneself.
(with back) To back off or step away unsteadily and quickly.
definitions.example: He reeled back from the punch.

definitions.definition: To make or cause to reel.
To have a whirling sensation; to be giddy.
